content.title: Intro
content.content:
1910
Preceded by
1910
1911
Year
1912
Followed by
1912

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1911.

content.title: February
content.content:
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the "Debating Society Report" in King Edward's School Chronicle.
28 - J.A.W. Bennett, Inkling, born in New Zealand.

content.title: March
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien's first poem, The Battle of the Eastern Field, and the report "Acta Senatus", are published in King Edward's School Chronicle.

content.title: June
content.content:
3 - Swedish translator Åke Ohlmarks is born.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the "Debating Society Report" and the Editorial in King Edward's School Chronicle.

content.title: July
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the Editorial in King Edward's School Chronicle.

content.title: Summer
content.content:
? - The Tolkiens go to holiday in Switzerland, where J.R.R. (alledgedly) finds a postcard of Der Berggeist.
Tolkien with a party of 12 wander on foot in Lauterbrunnen. Vivid memories of that adventure would form the basis for Rivendell and the Misty Mountains in The Hobbit.[1]

content.title: August
content.content: 12 - Felix Felton, who would play Bilbo Baggins, the Black Captain and Sauron in The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series), is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
3 - Michael Hordern, who would voice Gandalf in the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings, is born.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien signs a Oxford University visitor's page.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien creates the Tea Club and Barrovian Society at grammar school.

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien; Humphrey Carpenter, Christopher Tolkien (eds.), The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien, Letter 306, (undated, late 1967 - early 1968)
